item.title: Microsoft announces new ESU programs for more versions of Windows
item.description: Microsoft puts a $61 price tag on extended Windows security as more aging versions race toward the end of support. ...

item.title: Microsoft says 2026 is the moment for AI PCs, touts Windows 11 Recall, Copilot, and “the highest standard” of security
item.description: Microsoft says 2026 is the moment for AI computers, and it has listed some of the features you should look for.

item.title: Merci Microsoft pour cette mise à jour qui nous déconnecte du WiFi et Bluetooth !
item.description: La mise à jour de février KB5077181 pour Windows 11 vire au cauchemar pour de nombreux utilisateurs. Entre échecs d'installation, bugs de connexion et pannes matérielles, ce patch est censé améliorer le système mais le paralyse. La seule solution viable pour l'instant ? Le désinstaller au plus vite.

item.title: Privacy researcher debunks Microsoft Edge’s free VPN marketing, says it’s “NOT a VPN”
item.description: Microsoft promoted Edge Secure Network VPN as a free, built-in way to browse more securely, but a privacy researcher argues the feature only protects traffic inside the Edge browser.

item.title: Microsoft ranks Copilot as Windows 11’s top productivity app, above File Explorer and Snipping Tool
item.description: Microsoft lists Copilot as the number one productivity app for Windows 11, well above File Explorer and Snipping Tool.

item.title: Microsoft tests a Windows 11 taskbar feature that lets AI see your open apps when you share window
item.description: Microsoft is experimenting with a new Windows 11 taskbar setting that allows users to share any open app window directly with Copilot or other approved AI assistants. The feature builds on earlier “Share with Copilot” testing and shows how the taskbar is evolving into a dynamic hub for AI.

item.title: Microsoft Weekly: Gaming turmoil, big OneDrive update and new Windows 11 builds
item.description: Catch up with this week's Microsoft Weekly news recap about a shakeup at the company's gaming division, some changes to the Windows 11 Canary channel, and more. ...

item.title: This Windows security feature blocks dangerous drivers before they strike
item.description: Windows has a built-in driver kill list. This "invisible" Windows feature stops bad drivers in their tracks. ...

item.title: Microsoft is removing a security feature from the Edge browser
item.description: If you use Microsoft Edge's built-in password manager, there is an important change coming soon for you. ...

item.title: IT admins will love this Group Policy enhancement now available in Windows 11
item.description: Microsoft just made a quiet Windows 11 tweak that could save IT admins hours of painful GPO guesswork. ...

item.title: A highly-requested feature is finally coming to Paint in Windows 11
item.description: A new version of Paint is rolling out with a highly-requested feature from users, at least according to Microsoft. ...

item.title: CISA: BeyondTrust RCE flaw now exploited in ransomware attacks
item.description: Hackers are actively exploiting the CVE-2026-1731 vulnerability in the BeyondTrust Remote Support product, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) warns. [...]

item.title: Data breach at French bank registry impacts 1.2 million accounts
item.description: The French Ministry of Finance has published an announcement informing of a cybersecurity incident that has impacted 1.2 million accounts. [...]

item.title: Why the shift left dream has become a nightmare for security and developers
item.description: The "shift left" approach has increased pressure on developers, as speed demands override security checks in modern CI pipelines. Qualys explains how analyzing 34,000 public container images revealed 7.3% were malicious and why security must be enforced at the infrastructure layer by default. [...]

item.title: PayPal discloses data breach that exposed user info for 6 months
item.description: PayPal is notifying customers of a data breach after a software error in a loan application exposed their sensitive personal information, including Social Security numbers, for nearly 6 months last year. [...]

item.title: Exclusive: Microsoft is adding image support to Notepad on Windows 11
item.description: Windows Latest has learned that Microsoft is adding image support to Notepad on Windows 11, rolling out soon.

item.title: CISA orders feds to patch actively exploited Dell flaw within 3 days
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) ordered government agencies to patch their systems within three days against a maximum-severity Dell vulnerability that has been under active exploitation since mid-2024. [...]

item.title: Copilot quietly pulls your data from other Microsoft products, including Edge and MSN, but you can opt out
item.description: Microsoft Copilot automatically pulls your data from other Microsoft products, such as Bing, MSN, and Edge.

item.title: Microsoft shows off AI running on the Windows 11 taskbar and File Explorer
item.description: Microsoft just showed off "agents" on the taskbar via "Ask Copilot," which is an optional feature that replaces Windows Search.

item.title: Lecornu en équilibre entre soutien aux solutions de la DINUM et recours à la French tech
item.description: Le Premier ministre a publié une circulaire « relative à la commande publique numérique » couchant noir sur blanc la doctrine de l’État concernant les choix et achats de logiciels par ses services. Elle priorise l’utilisation de solutions internes existantes avant l’achat de produits « sur étagère ». Le développement de solutions en interne n’arrive qu’après. Depuis […]

item.title: New AI-powered summaries coming to Copilot Notebooks this March
item.description: Microsoft launches AI-powered insights for Copilot Notebooks. Get instant summaries and skip the manual synthesis. Full rollout ends mid-March. ...

item.title: Microsoft nomme une experte de l'IA à la tête de Xbox pour... "ne pas utiliser l'IA". Logique...
item.description: À peine nommée, la nouvelle PDG de Microsoft Gaming, Asha Sharma, fixe un cap clair : priorité aux grands jeux et à l'ADN de la marque. Elle promet de ne pas céder à la course au profit ni d'inonder l'écosystème de contenus générés par une IA sans âme, un message fort après le départ de Phil Spencer.

item.title: Phil Spencer quitte Xbox, Asha Sharma de CoreAI prend sa place
item.description: Passage de flambeau historique à la tête de la division Xbox chez Microsoft. Phil Spencer, qui incarne littéralement la console depuis son lancement, il y a 25 ans, a annoncé vendredi son départ à la retraite, 38 ans après son entrée chez l’éditeur. Dans un message interne reproduit sur le blog de Microsoft, il explique […]

item.title: Le chinois Moore Threads grille la politesse à Nvidia avec son propre PC portable ARM !
item.description: Alors que tous les regards sont tournés vers les futures puces ARM de Nvidia pour Windows, c’est son concurrent chinois qui tire le premier. Une démonstration de force technologique qui cache cependant une réalité plus complexe.

item.title: Microsoft Teams to launch express voice enrollment for easier voice isolation in meetings
item.description: Starting April, Teams users can enroll voice profiles just by speaking in meetings. Here is how admins can manage the PassiveVoiceEnroll rollout. ...

item.title: Incroyable : la colline de Windows XP retrouve presque son apparence d'origine !
item.description: La célèbre colline du fond d'écran "Bliss" de Windows XP a été photographiée dans un état quasi identique à l'original de 1996. Un cliché rare, capturé par un utilisateur de Reddit, qui montre un paysage verdoyant débarrassé de ses vignes habituelles, ravivant une vague de nostalgie pour une époque où les images emblématiques n'étaient pas encore générées par l'IA.

item.title: Arkanix Stealer pops up as short-lived AI info-stealer experiment
item.description: An information-stealing malware operation named Arkanix Stealer, promoted on multiple dark web forums towards the end of 2025, was likely developed as an AI-assisted experiment. [...]

item.title: 7 Days: Nvidia CEO has something big for you, Phil Spencer leaves Microsoft, and hell to pay
item.description: Our '7 Days' weekly tech roundup brings the juiciest announcements. Read about Pentagon drama (it involves AI), Apple's new devices, and more. ...

item.title: WhatsApp is testing Windows 11 “Resume” to pick up chats from Android
item.description: WhatsApp may soon let you continue Android conversations (and possibly calls) on Windows 11 via “Resume." This feature showed up on some PCs.

item.title: Predator spyware hooks iOS SpringBoard to hide mic, camera activity
item.description: Intellexa's Predator spyware can hide iOS recording indicators while secretly streaming camera and microphone feeds to its operators. [...]

item.title: Amazon: AI-assisted hacker breached 600 Fortinet firewalls in 5 weeks
item.description: Amazon is warning that a Russian-speaking hacker used multiple generative AI services as part of a campaign that breached more than 600 FortiGate firewalls across 55 countries in five weeks. [...]

item.title: Opinion: Windows 11 isn’t the disaster some claim – and it’s time to say so
item.description: Windows 11 has faced loud criticism, especially after a turbulent 2025, but the narrative ignores historical context. Every Windows version has gone through similar update cycles, bug waves, and trust rebuilds. We examine how scale, visibility, and rapid servicing shape perception and why most systems continue running without major issues.

item.title: Phil Spencer is exiting Microsoft as AI executive takes over Xbox
item.description: A massive leadership shakeup at Microsoft's gaming division sees Phil Spencer and Sarah Bond leaving the company. ...

item.title: LibreOffice blasts 'fake open source' OnlyOffice for working with Microsoft to lock users in
item.description: LibreOffice is expanding its line of attack, now targeting OnlyOffice, its rival, for being "partners with Microsoft in a strategy to lock users in." ...

item.title: Notepad is getting image support for some reason
item.description: Microsoft has already injected a lot of features into Notepad, and it is not stopping there. Images may be next. ...

item.title: Windows 11 bulid 28020.1619 brings cross-device resume, accessibility improvements, and more
item.description: The latest Canary build for Windows 11 is out under build number 28020.1619, bringing cross-device resume, accessibility improvements, and more. ...

item.title: Japanese tech giant Advantest hit by ransomware attack
item.description: Advantest Corporation disclosed that its corporate network has been targeted in a ransomware attack that may have affected customer or employee data. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 gets improved context menus, better spec cards, and more in new builds
item.description: Two new builds are rolling out in the Dev and Beta Channels with improved context menus, reworked PC spec cards, and more. ...

item.title: Microsoft is ending Edge support on one operating system this year
item.description: Microsoft released Edge 145 in the Beta Channel, and with it, announced the end of support for the browser on a certain operating system. ...

item.title: Mississippi medical center closes all clinics after ransomware attack
item.description: The University of Mississippi Medical Center (UMMC) closed all its clinic locations statewide on Thursday following a ransomware attack. [...]

item.title: FBI: Over $20 million stolen in surge of ATM malware attacks in 2025
item.description: The FBI warned that Americans lost more than $20 million last year amid a massive surge in ATM "jackpotting" attacks, in which criminals use malware to force cash machines to dispense money. [...]

item.title: Ukrainian gets 5 years for helping North Koreans infiltrate US firms
item.description: A Ukrainian national was sentenced to five years in prison for providing North Korean IT workers with stolen identities that helped them infiltrate U.S. companies. [...]

item.title: OneNote for iOS adds local backups: Recover your notes without IT support
item.description: Microsoft enables auto-backups for OneNote on iOS this March. Recover deleted notes via PC, no IT help required. Is your Intune policy ready? ...

item.title: Windows 11’s Drag Tray keeps popping up during drag-and-drop, frustrating desktop users
item.description: Windows 11’s Drag Tray automatically appears when dragging files, frustrating users who organize desktops the traditional way. Here’s why the feature exists, who it’s for, and how to disable or use Drag Tray without disrupting your workflow.

item.title: PromptSpy is the first known Android malware to use generative AI at runtime
item.description: Researchers have discovered the first known Android malware to use generative AI in its execution flow, using Google's Gemini model to adapt its persistence across different devices. [...]

item.title: Microsoft is retiring an Outlook feature because it was causing too much confusion for users
item.description: Microsoft is killing a long-standing Outlook feature next month, and IT admins have zero say in the sudden change. ...

item.title: Flaw in Grandstream VoIP phones allows stealthy eavesdropping
item.description: A critical vulnerability in Grandstream GXP1600 series VoIP phones allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to gain root privileges and silently eavesdrop on communications. [...]

item.title: Google blocked over 1.75 million Play Store app submissions in 2025
item.description: Google says that through 2025, it blocked more than 255,000 Android apps from obtaining excessive access to sensitive user data and rejected over 1.75 million apps from being published on Google Play due to policy violations. [...]

item.title: Un bug dans Microsoft 365 Copilot lui permettait de résumer des emails confidentiels
item.description: L’assistant IA inclus dans Microsoft 365 Copilot avait la possibilité de passer outre les mesures de sécurités censées être mises en place pour qu’il n’accède pas à tous les contenus des utilisateurs de la suite. BleepingComputer a relevé que Microsoft avait signalé depuis le 21 janvier ce bug dans son outil réservé aux administrateurs Microsoft […]
